content:
Apologies for the error. Based on the revised dimensions and assuming a cabin height of 1.90m, the payload capacity would be significantly reduced. Assuming an average weight of 75 kg per person, the payload capacity would be:

Payload capacity = MTOW - empty weight - fuel weight - baggage weight
Payload capacity = 2000 kg - 1170 kg - 288 kg - 240 kg
Payload capacity = 302 kg

This means that the maximum number of passengers would be limited to 4 or 5, depending on their weight and baggage. Alternatively, the payload capacity could be increased by reducing the fuel weight, but this would reduce the range of the Pig.
